TV screen measurements refer to the diagonal distance across the screen, so a $50$-inch TV would not be $50$ inches wide or $50$ inches high. When Claudia measured her parents' new $50$-inch TV, she found that its screen was a rectangle $40$ inches wide by $30$ inches high.  

**Draw the TV screen in the coordinate plane with the upper-left corner at $(-20,15)$ and the longer sides parallel to the $x$-axis. ** 

 (The units of the graph are in inches.)
